verses.text_plain: I am the man that hath seen affliction by the rod of his wrath.
verses.verse_html: 1I am the man that hath seen affliction by the rod of his wrath.

verses.text_plain: He hath led me, and brought me into darkness, but not into light.
verses.verse_html: 2He hath led me, and brought me into darkness, but not into light.

verses.text_plain: Surely against me is he turned; he turneth his hand against me all the day.
verses.verse_html: 3Surely against me is he turned; he turneth his hand against me all the day.

tokens.text: Surely against me is he turned

verses.text_plain: My flesh and my skin hath he made old; he hath broken my bones.
verses.verse_html: 4My flesh and my skin hath he made old; he hath broken my bones.

verses.text_plain: He hath builded against me, and compassed me with gall and travail.
verses.verse_html: 5He hath builded against me, and compassed me with gall and travail.

verses.text_plain: He hath set me in dark places, as they that be dead of old.
verses.verse_html: 6He hath set me in dark places, as they that be dead of old.

verses.text_plain: He hath hedged me about, that I cannot get out: he hath made my chain heavy.
verses.verse_html: 7He hath hedged me about, that I cannot get out: he hath made my chain heavy.

tokens.text: me about, that I cannot get out

verses.text_plain: Also when I cry and shout, he shutteth out my prayer.
verses.verse_html: 8Also when I cry and shout, he shutteth out my prayer.

verses.text_plain: He hath inclosed my ways with hewn stone, he hath made my paths crooked.
verses.verse_html: 9He hath inclosed my ways with hewn stone, he hath made my paths crooked.

verses.text_plain: He was unto me as a bear lying in wait, and as a lion in secret places.
verses.verse_html: 10He was unto me as a bear lying in wait, and as a lion in secret places.

verses.text_plain: He hath turned aside my ways, and pulled me in pieces: he hath made me desolate.
verses.verse_html: 11He hath turned aside my ways, and pulled me in pieces: he hath made me desolate.

verses.text_plain: He hath bent his bow, and set me as a mark for the arrow.
verses.verse_html: 12He hath bent his bow, and set me as a mark for the arrow.

verses.text_plain: He hath caused the arrows of his quiver to enter into my reins.
verses.verse_html:
13He hath caused the arrows of his quiver to enter into my reins.
 arrows: Heb. sons

verses.text_plain: I was a derision to all my people; and their song all the day.
verses.verse_html: 14I was a derision to all my people; and their song all the day.

verses.text_plain: He hath filled me with bitterness, he hath made me drunken with wormwood.
verses.verse_html:
15He hath filled me with bitterness, he hath made me drunken with wormwood.
 bitterness: Heb. bitternesses

verses.text_plain: He hath also broken my teeth with gravel stones, he hath covered me with ashes.
verses.verse_html:
16He hath also broken my teeth with gravel stones, he hath covered me with ashes.
 covered: or, rolled me in the ashes

footnotes.body_text: covered: or, rolled me in the ashes
footnotes.body_html: covered: or, rolled me in the ashes

verses.text_plain: And thou hast removed my soul far off from peace: I forgat prosperity.
verses.verse_html:
17And thou hast removed my soul far off from peace: I forgat prosperity.
 prosperity: Heb. good

verses.text_plain: And I said, My strength and my hope is perished from the Lord:
verses.verse_html: 18And I said, My strength and my hope is perished from the Lord:

verses.text_plain: Remembering mine affliction and my misery, the wormwood and the gall.
verses.verse_html:
19Remembering mine affliction and my misery, the wormwood and the gall.
 Remembering: or, Remember

verses.text_plain: My soul hath them still in remembrance, and is humbled in me.
verses.verse_html:
20My soul hath them still in remembrance, and is humbled in me.
 humbled: Heb. bowed

verses.text_plain: This I recall to my mind, therefore have I hope.
verses.verse_html:
21This I recall to my mind, therefore have I hope.
 recall: Heb. make to return to my heart

footnotes.body_text: recall: Heb. make to return to my heart
footnotes.body_html: recall: Heb. make to return to my heart

verses.text_plain: It is of the Lords mercies that we are not consumed, because his compassions fail not.
verses.verse_html: 22It is of the Lords mercies that we are not consumed, because his compassions fail not.

verses.text_plain: They are new every morning: great is thy faithfulness.
verses.verse_html: 23They are new every morning: great is thy faithfulness.

verses.text_plain: The Lord is my portion, saith my soul; therefore will I hope in him.
verses.verse_html: 24The Lord is my portion, saith my soul; therefore will I hope in him.

verses.text_plain: The Lord is good unto them that wait for him, to the soul that seeketh him.
verses.verse_html: 25The Lord is good unto them that wait for him, to the soul that seeketh him.

verses.text_plain: It is good that a man should both hope and quietly wait for the salvation of the Lord.
verses.verse_html: 26It is good that a man should both hope and quietly wait for the salvation of the Lord.

verses.text_plain: It is good for a man that he bear the yoke in his youth.
verses.verse_html: 27It is good for a man that he bear the yoke in his youth.

verses.text_plain: He sitteth alone and keepeth silence, because he hath borne it upon him.
verses.verse_html: 28He sitteth alone and keepeth silence, because he hath borne it upon him.

verses.text_plain: He putteth his mouth in the dust; if so be there may be hope.
verses.verse_html: 29He putteth his mouth in the dust; if so be there may be hope.

tokens.text: if so be there may be

verses.text_plain: He giveth his cheek to him that smiteth him: he is filled full with reproach.
verses.verse_html: 30He giveth his cheek to him that smiteth him: he is filled full with reproach.

verses.text_plain: For the Lord will not cast off for ever:
verses.verse_html: 31For the Lord will not cast off for ever:

verses.text_plain: But though he cause grief, yet will he have compassion according to the multitude of his mercies.
verses.verse_html: 32But though he cause grief, yet will he have compassion according to the multitude of his mercies.

verses.text_plain: For he doth not afflict willingly nor grieve the children of men.
verses.verse_html:
33For he doth not afflict willingly nor grieve the children of men.
 willingly: Heb. from his heart

footnotes.body_html: willingly: Heb. from his heart

verses.text_plain: To crush under his feet all the prisoners of the earth,
verses.verse_html: 34To crush under his feet all the prisoners of the earth,

verses.text_plain: To turn aside the right of a man before the face of the most High,
verses.verse_html:
35To turn aside the right of a man before the face of the most High,
 the most High: or, a superior

footnotes.body_text: the most High: or, a superior
footnotes.body_html: the most High: or, a superior

verses.text_plain: To subvert a man in his cause, the Lord approveth not.
verses.verse_html:
36To subvert a man in his cause, the Lord approveth not.
 approveth not: or, seeth not

footnotes.body_html: approveth not: or, seeth not

verses.text_plain: Who is he that saith, and it cometh to pass, when the Lord commandeth it not?
verses.verse_html: 37Who is he that saith, and it cometh to pass, when the Lord commandeth it not?

verses.text_plain: Out of the mouth of the most High proceedeth not evil and good?
verses.verse_html: 38Out of the mouth of the most High proceedeth not evil and good?

verses.text_plain: Wherefore doth a living man complain, a man for the punishment of his sins?
verses.verse_html:
39Wherefore doth a living man complain, a man for the punishment of his sins?
 complain: or, murmur

tokens.text: for the punishment of his sins

verses.text_plain: Let us search and try our ways, and turn again to the Lord.
verses.verse_html: 40Let us search and try our ways, and turn again to the Lord.

verses.text_plain: Let us lift up our heart with our hands unto God in the heavens.
verses.verse_html: 41Let us lift up our heart with our hands unto God in the heavens.

verses.text_plain: We have transgressed and have rebelled: thou hast not pardoned.
verses.verse_html: 42We have transgressed and have rebelled: thou hast not pardoned.

verses.text_plain: Thou hast covered with anger, and persecuted us: thou hast slain, thou hast not pitied.
verses.verse_html: 43Thou hast covered with anger, and persecuted us: thou hast slain, thou hast not pitied.

verses.text_plain: Thou hast covered thyself with a cloud, that our prayer should not pass through.
verses.verse_html: 44Thou hast covered thyself with a cloud, that our prayer should not pass through.

verses.text_plain: Thou hast made us as the offscouring and refuse in the midst of the people.
verses.verse_html: 45Thou hast made us as the offscouring and refuse in the midst of the people.

verses.text_plain: All our enemies have opened their mouths against us.
verses.verse_html: 46All our enemies have opened their mouths against us.

verses.text_plain: Fear and a snare is come upon us, desolation and destruction.
verses.verse_html: 47Fear and a snare is come upon us, desolation and destruction.

verses.text_plain: Mine eye runneth down with rivers of water for the destruction of the daughter of my people.
verses.verse_html: 48Mine eye runneth down with rivers of water for the destruction of the daughter of my people.

verses.text_plain: Mine eye trickleth down, and ceaseth not, without any intermission,
verses.verse_html: 49Mine eye trickleth down, and ceaseth not, without any intermission,

verses.text_plain: Till the Lord look down, and behold from heaven.
verses.verse_html: 50Till the Lord look down, and behold from heaven.

verses.text_plain: Mine eye affecteth mine heart because of all the daughters of my city.
verses.verse_html:
51Mine eye affecteth mine heart because of all the daughters of my city.
 mine heart: Heb. my soul
 ,
 because: or, more than all

footnotes.body_html: mine heart: Heb. my soul
because: or, more than all

verses.text_plain: Mine enemies chased me sore, like a bird, without cause.
verses.verse_html: 52Mine enemies chased me sore, like a bird, without cause.

verses.text_plain: They have cut off my life in the dungeon, and cast a stone upon me.
verses.verse_html: 53They have cut off my life in the dungeon, and cast a stone upon me.

verses.text_plain: Waters flowed over mine head; then I said, I am cut off.
verses.verse_html: 54Waters flowed over mine head; then I said, I am cut off.

verses.text_plain: I called upon thy name, O Lord, out of the low dungeon.
verses.verse_html: 55I called upon thy name, O Lord, out of the low dungeon.

verses.text_plain: Thou hast heard my voice: hide not thine ear at my breathing, at my cry.
verses.verse_html: 56Thou hast heard my voice: hide not thine ear at my breathing, at my cry.

verses.text_plain: Thou drewest near in the day that I called upon thee: thou saidst, Fear not.
verses.verse_html: 57Thou drewest near in the day that I called upon thee: thou saidst, Fear not.

verses.text_plain: O Lord, thou hast pleaded the causes of my soul; thou hast redeemed my life.
verses.verse_html: 58O Lord, thou hast pleaded the causes of my soul; thou hast redeemed my life.

verses.text_plain: O Lord, thou hast seen my wrong: judge thou my cause.
verses.verse_html: 59O Lord, thou hast seen my wrong: judge thou my cause.

verses.text_plain: Thou hast seen all their vengeance and all their imaginations against me.
verses.verse_html: 60Thou hast seen all their vengeance and all their imaginations against me.

verses.text_plain: Thou hast heard their reproach, O Lord, and all their imaginations against me;
verses.verse_html: 61Thou hast heard their reproach, O Lord, and all their imaginations against me;

verses.text_plain: The lips of those that rose up against me, and their device against me all the day.
verses.verse_html: 62The lips of those that rose up against me, and their device against me all the day.

verses.text_plain: Behold their sitting down, and their rising up; I am their musick.
verses.verse_html: 63Behold their sitting down, and their rising up; I am their musick.

verses.text_plain: Render unto them a recompence, O Lord, according to the work of their hands.
verses.verse_html: 64Render unto them a recompence, O Lord, according to the work of their hands.

verses.text_plain: Give them sorrow of heart, thy curse unto them.
verses.verse_html:
65Give them sorrow of heart, thy curse unto them.
 sorrow: or, obstinacy of heart

footnotes.body_html: sorrow: or, obstinacy of heart

verses.text_plain: Persecute and destroy them in anger from under the heavens of the Lord.
verses.verse_html: 66Persecute and destroy them in anger from under the heavens of the Lord.
